newsitem.title: USA: Ballot questions and bond referendums by state.
newsitem.headline: Ballot questions and bond referendums by state.

text.p: The following is a list of upcoming ballot initiatives and measures affecting municipal finance.
P - passed. D - defeated. NA - not available.
CALIFORNIA
June 3
--Two tax ballot issues to raise $60 million in Los Angeles County.
FLORIDA
June 10
--Marion County, half-cent sales tax increase for schools.
June 17
--Oglethorpe County, five-year extension of special purpose one-cent sales tax increase.
LOUISIANA
July 19
--Lafayette City-Parish votes on $222 million of capital improvement bonds for streets, drainage and recreation.
MISSISSIPPI
May 6
P --Pass Christian votes on $10.1 million GO bonds for schools.
NEW JERSEY
May 6
P --$6.6 million Caldwell School District, N.J., school general obligation bonds, for school renovations and technology improvements.
D --Wood-Ridge and Hasbrouck Heights, N.J., vote on forming a new regional school district.
NORTH CAROLINA
May 6
P --$35 million City of High Point GOs for upgrades at the Eastside WaterTreatment Plant.
P --$7 million City of High Point GOs for sewer system improvements.
P --$10 million City og High Point GOs for the city's share of the Randleman Dam project on the Deep River. P --$4 million City of High Point GOs for water system improvements.
P --$12 million City of High Point GOsfor street widening and resurfacing projects.
D --$500,000 City of High Point Gos for indoor swimming pool and athletic complex.
NA --$3 million City of High Point GOs for parks and recreation facilities.
P --$4.5 million Hoke County water system bonds.
May 20
--$59.5 million Dare County GO bonds for schools.
June 24
--$75 million of City of Winston-Salem GO bonds for streets, parks, housing and economic development.
